title: Barry Harris 7th Scale — Dominant 7th (Expanded Inference)
summary: EXPANDED INFERENCE: Includes 6th-diminished scale, enclosures, guide-tone targeting — common Barry Harris pedagogy but NOT explicitly stated in source transcript. Use maj7_v1 for source-grounded minimal rules. Adds b6 passing tone between 5 and 6, creating 8-note scale where chord tones land on downbeats.

pedagogy_intent.why_it_works: By adding a chromatic passing tone, the scale has 8 notes instead of 7. When played as continuous 8th notes starting on a downbeat, all 4 chord tones (1-3-5-b7) land on downbeats and all non-chord tones land on upbeats. This forces rhythmic discipline: the player cannot 'cheat' timing because wrong notes on strong beats are immediately audible. The constraint makes timing errors self-correcting.

special_passing_tones.reason: The Barry Harris 'extra note' â€” a diminished passing tone that makes the scale 8 notes, ensuring chord tones land on downbeats in continuous 8th note lines.

interval_rules.note: Chord tones are separated by whole steps or larger â€” never adjacent in the scale.
The b6 passing tone creates half-step motion between 5 and 6. This is the defining characteristic of the Barry Harris scale.
Whole step from b7 to root. The dominant 7th resolves up by whole step, not half step.
Avoid tritone leaps within lines â€” they disrupt the scalar flow and are hard to execute cleanly.

motion_rules.name: scalar_continuity
motion_rules.note: Barry Harris emphasizes running the scale up and down in continuous 8th notes. Leaps break the chord-tone-on-downbeat guarantee.

motion_rules.name: guide_tone_targeting
motion_rules.note: On chord changes, aim for 3rd or 7th of the new chord on beat 1 or 3. These are the 'money notes' that define the harmony.

motion_rules.name: chromatic_approach
motion_rules.note: When leaping is necessary, approach the target chord tone by half step from above or below.

motion_rules.name: enclosure_permitted
motion_rules.note: Enclosures (surrounding a chord tone with upper and lower neighbors) are permitted as they maintain the chord-tone-on-beat principle.

motion_rules.name: tendency_resolution
motion_rules.note: The 3rd and b7 of a dominant chord must resolve: 3rd moves to root or 3rd of target, b7 moves to 3rd of target.
